name: Analyser les publications LinkedIn des concurrents avec Bright Data + Google Gemini vers Google Sheets
description:
markdown*Ce flux de travail contient des nœuds communautaires qui ne sont compatibles qu'avec la version auto-hébergée de n8n.*

Ce flux de travail analyse automatiquement les publications LinkedIn des concurrents pour extraire des informations stratégiques et des modèles d'engagement. Il vous fait gagner du temps en éliminant l'analyse concurrentielle manuelle et fournit des informations marketing exploitables à partir de l'activité sur les réseaux sociaux de vos concurrents.

## Aperçu
Ce flux de travail extrait automatiquement les données des publications LinkedIn, y compris les métriques d'engagement, les commentaires et les détails du contenu, puis utilise l'IA pour analyser l'intention de la publication, son efficacité et les principaux enseignements marketing. Il transforme les données brutes de LinkedIn en intelligence concurrentielle structurée stockée dans Google Sheets.

## Outils Utilisés
* **n8n** : La plateforme d'automatisation qui orchestre le flux de travail
* **Bright Data** : Pour extraire les données des publications LinkedIn sans restrictions
* **Google Gemini** : Agent IA pour l'analyse intelligente des publications et l'extraction d'informations
* **Google Sheets** : Pour stocker les données d'intelligence concurrentielle structurée

## Comment Installer
1. **Importer le Flux de Travail** : Téléchargez le fichier .json et importez-le dans votre instance n8n
2. **Configurer Bright Data** : Ajoutez vos identifiants Bright Data au nœud d'extraction
3. **Configurer Google Gemini** : Configurez vos identifiants API Google Gemini
4. **Configurer Google Sheets** : Connectez votre compte Google Sheets et copiez le modèle de feuille de calcul
5. **Personnaliser** : Il vous suffit de coller n'importe quelle URL de publication LinkedIn et d'exécuter le flux de travail

## Cas d'Utilisation
* **Équipes Marketing** : Comprendre quel contenu génère de l'engagement pour les concurrents
* **Stratèges de Contenu** : Identifier les formats de publication et les stratégies de message réussis
* **Gestionnaires de Réseaux Sociaux** : Évaluer la performance de votre contenu par rapport aux leaders du secteur
* **Agences/Consultants** : Offrir une analyse concurrentielle LinkedIn en tant que service à des clients

## Connectez-vous avec Moi
* **Site Web** : https://www.nofluff.online
* **YouTube** : https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
* **LinkedIn** : https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
* **Obtenez Bright Data** : https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Utiliser ce lien soutient mes flux de travail gratuits avec une petite commission)

#n8n #automatisation #analytiqueLinkedIn #intelligenceconcurrentielle #brightdata #extractionWeb #marketinga

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "summary": "This LinkedIn post recaps highlights from the FWD: London event. Instead of listing them directly, it encourages viewers to watch a highlight video to experience the energy and insights from the event firsthand.",
  "post_intent": "Event recap",
  "engagement_level": "Medium",
  "engagement_reason": "With 107 likes and 2 comments, the post shows moderate engagement for a brand with over 200,000 followers.",
  "audience_insight": "The tone is enthusiastic and community-driven, targeting marketers and event attendees interested in industry trends and networking.",
  "marketing_takeaway": "Use video content with real attendee testimonials to create an authentic event recap that resonates emotionally with the audience."
}

parameters.content:
## 🟩 **Section 1: 🔗 URL Input & Trigger**

### 🎛️ Nodes Involved:

* `⚡ Start Analysis (Manual Trigger)`
* `✍️ Set LinkedIn Post URL`

### 🧠 What's Happening:

This section is your **starting point**. The workflow begins when a user manually triggers the automation by clicking a button in n8n. Then, the user **inputs the LinkedIn post URL** they want to analyze.

### 🔍 Explanation:

* This trigger node allows anyone (even non-developers) to launch the analysis with **just a click**.
* The `Set` node is used to **manually insert the LinkedIn post URL** — the only required input!

### 🛠 How Beginners Can Use It:

* You don’t need coding or scraping knowledge.
* Just copy any public LinkedIn post URL, paste it into the `Set` node, and hit “Execute Workflow.”
* This makes it perfect for **marketing interns, assistants, or analysts** to run competitive analysis.

---

## 🟨 **Section 2: 🧠 Data Extraction + AI Analysis**

### 🧩 Nodes Involved:

* `📦 Scrape LinkedIn Post Details (Bright Data)`
* `🤖 Analyze Post with AI Agent`

  * `🔮 Gemini Model (Chat)`
  * `🧰 Auto-Fix Output JSON`
  * `🧾 Structured Output Parser`

### 🧠 What's Happening:

This is the **core engine** of the automation. First, Bright Data scrapes all the post content — including text, comments, engagement stats, and media. Then, an AI agent (powered by Google Gemini) analyzes this post using a smart prompt to return **insightful and structured output**.

### ⚙️ Step-by-Step:

1. **🔍 Scrape**: Bright Data extracts all key metadata from the LinkedIn post.
2. **🧠 AI Agent**: The extracted data is passed to an AI model (Gemini), which:

   * Summarizes the post
   * Identifies its purpose (event, promotion, etc.)
   * Rates engagement
   * Infers target audience
   * Suggests a marketing takeaway
3. **🛠 Output Parser**: The response is auto-validated and structured into clean JSON.

### 💡 How Beginners Can Use It:

* Even if you don’t know how AI or APIs work, this section handles all the **complex reasoning**.
* Just sit back and let AI tell you:

  * What your competitors are posting
  * How engaging those posts are
  * What lessons you can learn from them
* It's perfect for **content strategists, social media teams, or consultants**.

---

## 🟦 **Section 3: 📊 Save to Sheet**

### 📘 Node Involved:

* `📤 Save Analysis to Google Sheet`

Copy this spreadsheet:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EKF6MLQN9suxGDzqlkARkDnSA-x75IpJbB0PXIx_E1Q/edit?usp=sharing

### 🧠 What's Happening:

This final node **stores the AI-generated analysis** in a connected Google Sheet. Each new LinkedIn post you analyze adds a new row — turning your sheet into a **real-time intelligence database**.

### 📈 Output Example:

| Company   | Post Title             | Engagement | Intent      | Takeaway                                       |
| --------- | ---------------------- | ---------- | ----------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| Mailchimp | FWD: London Highlights | Medium     | Event Recap | Use testimonial videos for better event recall |

### 🧾 How Beginners Can Use It:

* All the insights get saved automatically — **no copy-paste needed**.
* This sheet can be shared with your marketing team, used in slide decks, or reviewed weekly.
* It becomes a **live knowledge hub** of what competitors are saying and how well it's working.

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## 🌟 **LinkedIn Competitive Intelligence Automation**

> Analyze any public LinkedIn post from competitors, influencers, or market leaders using Bright Data + AI — and store the analysis directly into Google Sheets.

---

## 🟩 **Section 1: 🔗 URL Input & Trigger**

### 🎛️ Nodes Involved:

* `⚡ Start Analysis (Manual Trigger)`
* `✍️ Set LinkedIn Post URL`

### 🧠 What's Happening:

This section is your **starting point**. The workflow begins when a user manually triggers the automation by clicking a button in n8n. Then, the user **inputs the LinkedIn post URL** they want to analyze.

### 🔍 Explanation:

  * `🔮 Gemini Model (Chat)`

### 🧠 What's Happening:

This is the **core engine** of the automation. First, Bright Data scrapes all the post content — including text, comments, engagement stats, and media. Then, an AI agent (powered by Google Gemini) analyzes this post using a smart prompt to return **insightful and structured output**.

### ⚙️ Step-by-Step:

1. **🔍 Scrape**: Bright Data extracts all key metadata from the LinkedIn post.
2. **🧠 AI Agent**: The extracted data is passed to an AI model (Gemini), which:

### 💡 How Beginners Can Use It:

## 🟦 **Section 3: 📊 Save to Sheet**

### 📘 Node Involved:

### 🧠 What's Happening:

This final node **stores the AI-generated analysis** in a connected Google Sheet. Each new LinkedIn post you analyze adds a new row — turning your sheet into a **real-time intelligence database**.

### 📈 Output Example:

| Company   | Post Title             | Engagement | Intent      | Takeaway                                       |
| --------- | ---------------------- | ---------- | ----------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| Mailchimp | FWD: London Highlights | Medium     | Event Recap | Use testimonial videos for better event recall |

### 🧾 How Beginners Can Use It:

* All the insights get saved automatically — **no copy-paste needed**.
* This sheet can be shared with your marketing team, used in slide decks, or reviewed weekly.
* It becomes a **live knowledge hub** of what competitors are saying and how well it's working.

---

## ✅ **Final Benefits**

✨ **For Agencies / Consultants**
Offer LinkedIn post benchmarking as a service.

📊 **For Marketing Teams**
Understand what kind of content performs well.

📚 **For Beginners**
Run complex AI + scraping analysis without writing a single line of code.

---

## I’ll receive a tiny commission if you join Bright Data through this link—thanks for fueling more free content!

### https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25
